definition: To provide nourishment to an offspring by allowing it to draw sustenance from a specific part of the body, typically associated with mammals. This action is commonly observed in the animal kingdom and is an essential process for the survival and growth of newborns.

examples.english: The mother is nursing her baby.
The cow is suckling her calf.
The cat is nursing her kittens.
The wet nurse is breastfeeding the orphan.
The woman is nursing her newborn.
